definition:
Hopper-locking powers inactive hoppers with redstone to prevent them from doing anything, reducing lag. Because a locked hopper canâ€™t move items, it can skip several expensive checks each tick and generate far less lag. As a result, many older storage-tech builds include wiring to lock hoppers as an optimization.

## Lithium makes hopper locking optional
[Lithium](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/lithium) is a mod used on most technical Minecraft servers. Lithium includes an optimization that automatically manages inactive hoppers so they produce essentially no lag, effectively "locking" them without any extra wiring. **If you have Lithium, manual hopper locking won't improve performance.** (See RD001)
